title: [HiFi][Dgtl] Espers (20 of 26 issues|Eclipse/Epic/Image|1986-98)
description:
gesserit presents:

   A Hitlist Fills Torrent ( <a href=" http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/9591710" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/9591710</a>  ):

      A Collection of Digital Releases:


         Espers                 (1986, 1990) (Dgtl-TPB-1280) (Hexidecimal-Empire)

         The Complete Interface (1989)                       (Kritter-DCP)

         Espers 01-07           (1997-1998)                  (Minutemen-Midas)


        <a href=" http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Espers_(comic)" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Espers_(comic)</a>

         As the (itself rather messy) article indicates, the publication history of
         this title is a total mess: It started out at Eclipse, moved to Marvel's
         Epic imprint, which published a second bunch of issues and re-published the
         first bunch in a trade edition. A third bunch of issues was published via
         Halloween Comics, the author's own indie label. Finally, the series moved
         to Image, which published a fourth bunch of issues and re-published some of
         the second, the third, and some of the fourth bunches as trade volumes.

         The HiFi proper is the digital trade edition of the first (Eclipse) run.
         Single-issue editions of the second (Epic) and fourth (Image) runs are
         included as bonuses. Unfortunately, most of the single-issue editions as
         well as the trade edition of the third (Halloween) run have not been
         scanned, which accounts for the six missing issues indicated in the title.
